title: How to Learn About Sedimentary Rocks

steps.headline: Understand how sedimentary rocks are made.
steps.description: Existing rocks are eroded mainly by water or ice, deposited in rivers, lakes, and oceans. When these particles are dropped they build up gradually in layer upon layer. Over millions of years, these sediments are buried deeply and are exposed to pressure and temperature turning soft sediment to rock. Collisions of continents and other forces bring these rocks to surface; are exposed and the cycle begins again.

steps.headline: Be aware of the different types of sedimentary rocks:
Recognise that this article provides only a very basic overview of sedimentary rocks.
steps.description: The most important thing to remember about sedimentary rocks is that they record the long history of our planet.
